items.content_html: I am currently in commercial contract in the french research-action cooperative Oxamyne, where I developp an activity in dynamic modelling, collective intelligence design, and scientific tutoring. I am working on a longer term project aiming to federate synergic research-action project aimed at building awareness of systemic consequences of human action & strategies to manage socio-ecological complexities.

items.title: About me
items.summary: I am a complex systems researcher who participates in the construction of an integrated conception of life, cognition, and culture as an enactive…
items.content_html:
I am a complex systems researcher who participates in the construction of an integrated conception of life, cognition, and culture as an enactive dynamical process across scales. I draw from both philosophical and computational tools to understand how and why complex functional entities assemble in living systems, and what it means to exist as such a unit. I seek to discover why particular systems create meaning, how this process is embedded in the evolution of human societies, and what it means for our role as situated humans in shaping the collective future.

I want to participate in building societies that will withstand the test of the so-called Anthropocene era, which I extend my research work beyond classical (academic) institutions. I founded and coordinate the Kairos participative research & scientific mediation collective which focuses on synthesising complexity-oriented approaches to social sciences. I also work on a cooperative project aimed at integrated synergic research-action approaches to build governance systems and actors network that can navigate real world complexity.

I have a broader commitment to reveal what’s below sensible reality and beyond the means of our linguistic grasp. This is why I’m interested in various ways to convey meaning without the need for formal language, from (classical) graphical design to creative ventures. I write an uchronical fiction which seeks to expose the intrication of spirituality and power by conveying the subjective view point of protagonists and bystanders in the historical dynamics by which a neognostic cult asserts itself as an hegemonic geopolitical power then desintegrate into civil warfare.

Find me on OSF, Github, and Ko-Fi, or contact me if you’d like.
